channel.title: CyberNetSec - Cyberattack
channel.description: Latest cyberattack threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: CISA KEV Alert: XWiki RCE Flaw Actively Exploited for Cryptomining
item.description:
The US Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has added a critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability in the XWiki enterprise wiki platform, CVE-2025-24893, to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog. The flaw, rated 9.8 on the CVSS scale, allows an unauthenticated ...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Telecom Giant Ribbon Communications Breached by Nation-State Actor for 10 Months
item.description:
Telecommunications provider Ribbon Communications has disclosed a significant security breach by a suspected nation-state actor. According to an SEC filing, the attackers first gained access in December 2024 and remained undetected for nearly a year until September 2025. The company, which serves cr...

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Threat Actor, Supply Chain Attack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Canada Issues National Alert as Hacktivists Target Critical Infrastructure
item.description:
The Canadian Centre for Cyber Security, along with the RCMP, has issued a national alert warning of increasing cyberattacks by hacktivists against the nation's critical infrastructure. The advisory follows multiple successful breaches of internet-accessible Industrial Control Systems (ICS) in sector...

Severity: High

Categories: Industrial Control Systems, Policy and Compliance, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Ad Giant Dentsu's Subsidiary Merkle Hit by Cyberattack, Staff and Client Data Exposed
item.description:
Global advertising firm Dentsu has confirmed that its US-based customer experience management (CXM) subsidiary, Merkle, was the target of a cyberattack. The company detected 'abnormal activity' on Merkle's network and proactively shut down certain systems to contain the threat. An investigation has ...

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Data Breach, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: "Shadow Escape": New Zero-Click Attack Steals Data from ChatGPT, Claude, and Gemini
item.description:
A novel zero-click attack vector named "Shadow Escape" has been discovered by researchers at Operant, capable of silently exfiltrating sensitive data from popular AI agents like OpenAI's ChatGPT, Anthropic's Claude, and Google's Gemini. The attack exploits the Model Context Protocol (MCP) by embeddi...

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Cloud Security, Data Breach

Read Full Article →

item.title: Chrome Zero-Day Exploited by "Mem3nt0 mori" APT to Deploy Spyware
item.description:
A critical zero-day vulnerability in Google Chrome, CVE-2025-2783, has been actively exploited in a targeted espionage campaign dubbed "Operation ForumTroll." The campaign, which began in March 2025, is attributed to the advanced persistent threat (APT) group known as "Mem3nt0 mori." The attackers u...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Threat Actor, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Everest Ransomware Hits Swedish Power Grid Operator, Steals 280GB of Data
item.description:
Sweden's national electricity operator, Svenska kraftnät, has confirmed a data breach following a claim by the Everest ransomware group. The attackers alleged on their dark web leak site that they had stolen 280 GB of internal data. Svenska kraftnät stated that the attack was confined to an external...

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Data Breach, Industrial Control Systems

Read Full Article →

item.title: Critical Apache Tomcat Flaws Expose Servers to RCE and Console Hijacking
item.description:
The Apache Software Foundation has released patches for two critical vulnerabilities, CVE-2025-55752 and CVE-2025-55754, affecting Apache Tomcat versions 9, 10, and 11. The most severe flaw, CVE-2025-55752, is a directory traversal bug that can be escalated to remote code execution (RCE) if non-defa...

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: CISA Adds Actively Exploited Motex LANSCOPE RCE Flaw to KEV Catalog
item.description:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has added a critical vulnerability in Motex's LANSCOPE Endpoint Manager, CVE-2025-61932, to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog following confirmation of active attacks. The flaw, rated 9.3 CVSS, allows for unauthenticate...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Cyberattack

item.title: Critical Adobe Commerce Flaw Under Active Exploitation, CISA Warns
item.description:
A critical improper input validation vulnerability in Adobe Commerce and Magento, tracked as CVE-2025-54236, is being actively exploited in the wild. Dubbed 'SessionReaper,' the flaw allows an unauthenticated remote attacker to hijack user sessions via the REST API, leading to potential web shell de...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cyberattack, Data Breach

Read Full Article →
